definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

sentences.english: Romania and Hungary are operating under I.M.F.
sentences.chinese: 罗马尼亚和匈牙利正在接受国际货币基金组织的救助。

sentences.english: Greece should have been allowed to default and restructure under the guidance of the International Monetary Fund, Professor Wyplosz said.
sentences.chinese: 应该让希腊在国际货币基金组织的指导下开始重组。

sentences.english: One hundred eighty-seven nations belong to the IMF.
sentences.chinese: 世界上有187个国家属于国际货币基金组织。

sentences.english: He is a former head of the InternationalMonetary Fund’s China Division.
sentences.chinese: 他是国际货币基金组织中国部的前领导人。

sentences.english: The International Monetary Fund used to be the bailout king.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织曾经是救火大王。

sentences.english: He is seeking to become the first non-European to lead the international lender.
sentences.chinese: 他正寻求成为首任非欧州的国际货币基金组织主席。

sentences.english: April 17, 1980 the IMF decided to resume the formal representation of our country.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织正式决定恢复我国的代表权。
国际货币基金组织则承诺提供300亿。

sentences.english: The IMF & World Bank take hostage entire nations.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织和世界银行胁持整个国家。
